intro: Aneilema foliosum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its attractive, velvety leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, often reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its foliage is broad and heart-shaped, with a deep green color that provides a striking contrast to its vibrant purple and pink blooms. Aneilema foliosum is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
